name: observations
title: observations
description: Table of all observations associated with the equipment, retrieval, or control of a tag

fields.name: tag_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the tag. Foreign key to [`tags.tag_id`](/core/tags#tag_id).

fields.name: datetime
fields.description: Date and time of the observation. Formatted as an ISO 8601 string (`YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`).

fields.name: location_name
fields.description: Given name of the observation location. It might be helpful to keep a human-readable name of the location to differentiate the location of different observations more easily.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: Latitude of the observation location in decimal degrees, using the WGS84 datum.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: Longitude of the observation location in decimal degrees, using the WGS84 datum.

fields.name: observation_type
fields.description:
Type of observation. 
 - `equipment`: Attachment of the tag on the animal
 - `retrieval`: Recapture and removal of the tag from the animal
 - `recapture`: Recapture of the animal AFTER an equipment observation but without removing the tag. This option also covers the case of recapturing a bird without a device (choose `missing`in `device_status`) or the case of a recapture happening after a `retrieval`.
 - `sighting`: Known presence of the bird on a date and location besides ringing (e.g. direct observation in the field with color ring)
 - `other`: Other type of observation. Avoid using this, and if using, always provide [`observation_comments`](core/observations/#observation_comments).

fields.name: device_status
fields.description: Status of the tag. Assumed to be `present` if not provided. Always provide [`observation_comments`](core/observations/#observation_comments) if using `unknown`.

fields.name: observer
fields.description: The name of the individual or group who made the observation.

fields.name: catching_method
fields.description:
Catching method according to [EURING Exchange Code](https://euring.org/files/documents/E2020ExchangeCodeV201.pdf#page=12). Generally, one of:
 - `M`: *M*isnet
 - `N`: on *n*est
 - `Z`: unknown

fields.name: life_stage
fields.description:
Life stage of the bird according to the age class in [EURING Exchange Code](https://euring.org/files/documents/E2020ExchangeCodeV201.pdf#page=14). 
- `0`: Unknown
- `1`: Pullus
- `2`: Full-grown
- `2`: 1yr
- `3`: >1yr
- `4`: 2yr
- `5`: >2yr

fields.name: sex
fields.description: Sex of the bird according to [EURING Exchange Code](https://euring.org/files/documents/E2020ExchangeCodeV201.pdf#page=13) as male `M`, female `F` or unknown `U`.

fields.name: condition
fields.description: Condition of bird follow a simplified version of [EURING Exchange Code](https://euring.org/files/documents/E2020ExchangeCodeV201.pdf#page=23). Assumed to be `alive` if not provided

fields.name: mass
fields.description: Mass of the tagged animal. See [EURING Exchange Code](https://euring.org/files/documents/E2020ExchangeCodeV201.pdf#page=27). Expressed in grams.

fields.name: wing_length
fields.description: Maximum chord measurement. See [EURING Exchange Code](https://euring.org/files/documents/E2020ExchangeCodeV201.pdf#page=26). Expressed in milimeters.

fields.name: additional_metric
fields.description: A list of additional measurements, facts, characteristics, or assertions about the record. Recommended best practice is to use a key:value encoding schema for a data interchange format such as JSON.

fields.name: observation_comments
fields.description: Comments or notes about the observation.
